comment: Get the book, she reads from it quite a bit. Her tests are open notes open book. Her tests asked questions that we never went over or discussed in class so they were kinda hard. Her hand writing is bad (sorry) so if she asks someone to help then volunteer, or else you wont get any notes down.

Professor Peters is my favorite professor at Kennesaw. She truly cares about each student & designs curriculum based on what you want to get out of the class. The stories she shares are relevant & like many other classes, the activities & lectures do not seem pointless. Ive taken 3 of her classes & throughly enjoyed each one.
I took two tests the whole semester. They were both open note, online. Peters is the best. She is inclusive, funny, great life stories, and a wonderful teacher. I would LOVE to take her again!!!!!!

I honestly don't see why she has a high rating. Tests are confusing. Lectures in class don't correlate with what's in the book so it's impossible to study. She also waits until literally the last minute to grade any assignment so good luck trying to figure out your grade until she posts the final one. Her group projects suck.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Peters is super helpful. Assignments are very easy! Exams were open book and online. Loved her!

Make sure to attend class! Most of her test questions come from class room lectures. Tests are difficult and I attended almost all classes. Take notes! If she says something or writes something on the board it will probably be on the test!

Dr. Peters is a wonderful professor. I've learned quite a bit of useful and interesting things in her class. She does not like if you are late or absent to class, so try to be there on time. There were only 2 test during the summer, a few graded assignments, and pretty much 2 papers. I decided to enroll in one of her classes next semester.
Very down to earth professor. Not many assignments and only had two test which were both online. Only downside is that she takes FOREVER to grade assignments and tests.

Lost of students like her teaching style.  Personally I like teachers that are more organize and that they are in the class.  She takes other students to study out of US while her class is beign lecture by someone else.  She may be a great professor but since she has to much on her plate students don't get the best of her.

She has a lot to offer although I feel she has too much on her plate at KSU.  She seems preoccupied with other things to teach and doesn't return papers/tests on time.  Her tests are from the book so heavy reading is mandatory.  I felt as though I was in Grad School when taking her tests.  I do wish she could stay on track. "Squirrel!" Nice Teacher
Dr. Peters mainly teaches upper level classes and this was one of her first times teaching the intro course. She is passionate about what she teaches and grades fairly. come to class

She is inconsiderate and demands her way. She  cuts people off when they have something to say that she doesn't like. She's not good at returning papers in a timely manner and is extremely moody. She talks too much about all her personal life in detail.
She like sociology better. Good teacher. I liked her... tests are from book. and she be doing random book quizzes on readings.

Loved Dr. Peters! P&C was one of my favs last semester, loved alot about what others kind about other cultures. Will need the book and read prior to class, have to attend class to stay on top of topics. 2 major papers in APA format, received an "A"

Dr. Peters was a great teacher. She loved the Poverty & Culture! Was eager to share her insight with the class. You will need the book and have to attend class. Two papers will be written and 2 test.  Was not a fan of her test, read the questions, she is tricky on the wording. Looking for to having her again.
She is the one of the best teachers, but do your work and never be late for her class.
pretty nice personality/liberal topics and views/short essays make up bulk of assignments/ 1 long paper/tests are easy but are based heavily from notes and some text content so come to class!!/

Dr. Peters in defintely a great teacher. She makes you enjoy coming. She gets involved and makes you want to openly communicate with the class. This is class will be one that I remember for years to come. She can be somewhat demanding, but what teacher isn't Highly recommended!!!

Dr. Peters is one of my favorite professors! She is very experienced in the field and uses those experiences within her lectures. Definetly read the book...class is always a huge discussion of the readings. Her tests arent too difficult as long as you come to class and read.

This was an awesome class. Finally, I have got my money's worth at KSU. Dr. Peters is so awesome, the best in the department. I loved her style of lecture, very engaging. You will DEFINITELY get something out of her class. I have learned so much from her class and I would recommend her to anyone! She is very nice and understanding outside of class.
shes a cool instructor/pretty easy assignments/mostly short papers (longest was 7-8 pgs)/

Dr. Peters is a very nice teacher. She knows a lot about what she teaches and expects you to come out of her class knowing everything she covered. She is not easy but is also not extremely hard. There are a couple papers and presentations. Her test can be hard. Really study, she does not review very much. I learned a lot and enjoyed the class!
Tke Dr.Peters if you want to learn something. Take someone else if you just want a grade.

First of allDr.Peters is no longer in Political Science department. She is in Human Services. Take her if you really want to learn something. Consider an alternative professor if you just want a grade.
Don't cross her!  She'll keep you down through her grading process.  Hold your breath and watch out for her big head.

I didn't like her class.  She was boring.  All she did was lecture the whole time and her lectures were really more based on her opinions than anything else.  All her tests are open book.. (so that's good) but they are hard, and there are too many other misc. assingments to do.
No Comments
great professor, great course!  you won't regret it!
God, I love her. I'm taking her next semester also. If all teachers were this open and caring EVERYONE would stay in college.
No Comments
excellent professor who really makes the course interesting
